name: bootstrap-horizon
tagline: Boostrap 3 rows with inline, horizontally scrolling columns.
body:
bootstrap-horizon [![bower package](https://badge.fury.io/bo/bootstrap-horizon.svg)](http://badge.fury.io/bo/bootstrap-horizon) [![npm version](https://badge.fury.io/js/bootstrap-horizon.svg)](http://badge.fury.io/js/bootstrap-horizon) ================= Boostrap 3 rows with inline, horizontally scrolling columns. Inspired by [Ravimallya @ StackOverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/20332830/bootstrap-3-horizontal-scrollable-row-website-design/20335239#20335239) Example ------- This `.well` fills the viewport and has a `.row.row-horizon` inside with a bunch of `.col-*-6`. Installation ------------ ### Bower ``` bower install bootstrap-horizon ``` ### npm ``` npm install bootstrap-horizon ``` Usage ----- Include bootstrap-horizon.css *after* bootstrap.css ``` ``` Add the `.row-horizon` class to `.rows` that require horizontal scrolling. In order to improve the UX, bootstrap-horizon overrides bootstrap's `.col-*-*` classes to make the baseline width 90% instead of 100% which allows for a small portion of the last column to be displayed. ```
